[u][b]-Quick Review-[/b][/u]
Half-Life 2 is a First Person Shooter developed by Valve and released late 2004. This is actually the first game I owned and played on my steam account, I cannot speak highly enough of the whole Half-Life series.


[u][b]-Detailed breakdown review-[/b][/u]
[b]Story:[/b] Half-Life 2 starts on a train arriving at City 17, you play as the protagonist “Gordon Freeman”, get used to that name, because everyone knows it and exclaims it when they see you. [i](Well, everyone but the “Combine” police force, when they first see you in the introduction level at City 17.)[/i]
Not long after getting off the train, you come across old acquaintances Dr. Kleiner and Barney Calhoun, they send Gordon on his way to join up with an underground group known as the "Lambda Resistance".
I won't risk saying and spoiling anything about the rest of story; this is one of the games that I contrast against many other story telling narratives – because it's so well done. Even replaying the game after so many years, Half-Life 2 is still a very enjoyable game and I believe the series will survive the test of time to become a staple in video game history. [i](At LEAST Steam history)[/i]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=519103207


[b]Gameplay:[/b] As you progress through the game you unlock new weapons, and explore new area's, you can switch between your weapons with the scroll wheel or number keys, sometimes you double up on the same weapon categories [i](for example, you might have two pistols, or two rifles so you'll need to scroll through both of those, or hit the key twice to rotate between them)[/i]
All of your standard FPS's are in the game, your basic “go to” [i](Bread-and-butter, Rice-and-beans, defaulted-to, basic, etc)[/i] weapons are: The crowbar, pistol, and Submachine Gun.
The weapons you unlock are: [spoiler]Crowbar, Gravity Gun, Bugbait, 9mm pistol, .357 Magnum, SMG, AR2 Pulse Rifle, Shotgun, Crossbow, Grenade, and RPG.[/spoiler]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=519103220


[b]Achievements:[/b] About half of the achievements in Half-Life 2 are unlocked on your first play through, the other half are Easter eggs, or various objectives challanges.
The hardest/longest achievement is Lambda Locator, which requires you to find each Lambda Cache. [i](The Greek letter “L” is known as Lambda “λ”)[/i] As you play through the game you will sometimes come across a “λ” Lambda, that means there's a Lambda Resistance weapons cache nearby.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=520091228

[b]Price:[/b] The standalone price for Half-Life 2 is $9.99 you will probably come close to nine hours of gameplay within this game. I've personally replayed the story several times so for me it was a great value.
However, I have a better recommendation; if you are thinking about getting Half-Life 2, Half-Life 2: Episode One, Half-Life 2: Episode Two, and/or Portal, you should purchase [url=http://store.steampowered.com/sub/469/]The Orange Box[/url] for $19.99, you will get all of the afore mentioned game titles.

[b]Conclusion:[/b] Story: Excellent, a personal all-time favorite of mine. Gameplay: Solid controls, solid physics, solid, solid solid. Even after all these years the game is still very good. Achievements: Fairly doable 100% completed game. Price: Fair, but I suggest getting the Orange Box deal.
I recommend this game to people who enjoy darker serious stories, FPS's, or don't swear by the latest game releases [i](Translation: you as a gamer are backwards compatible with older games/graphics/engines)[/i].
Thanks for reading my review! I have a couple great stories of my first experience in Ravenholm when I was younger, if you'd like to hear them drop me a message.

Ignore my time played, I have played the stand alone version many times.

Put simply, this game is a masterpiece! It may be the best shooter ever made. I don't think there is much left to be said these days, but if you're one of the two people that still hasn't played this, buy it! Buy it right now and have fun.... The extra episodes are worth a play also. Roll on HL3, It can't be far away now... ;)

10/10

This game is definitely one of the best on Steam. I've had so much fun playing through it. The world is well developed, immersive, and interactable. You can shoot sawblades into wooden objects to keep them there while you perform another task. You can shoot paint cans at objects, and it will turn them white. You can crouch behind a crashed car and push it up towards baddies until you run them over. You can get in a crane and drop shipping containers on people. Most of the challenge comes from just finding your way around. Despite the fact that a simple scientist is capable of killing so many people, the story is unique and captivating. The gameplay is diverse, challenging, and fun. The environment is lovely, which is typical of all the production aspects of this game. In my opinion every gamer should experience this game.

Un capolavoro senza tempo!
Avendoli rigiocati entrambi uno di seguito all'altro direi che ad oggi HL2 è perfino migliore del capostipite. Ricordo però che all'epoca, il primo capitolo mi sembrò altrettanto spettacolare, se non addirittura perfetto. Per non scontentare nessuno li metterei esattamente sullo stesso piano. Due pietre miliari, anelli di congiunzione di un ciclo dei evoluzione degli FPS.
La saga incarna la progressiva evoluzione tra gli sparatutto "old-scool", in cui il gioco era un susseguirsi di livelli scarsamente coesi tra loro, con meccaniche di gioco assolutamente inverosimili (ma non per questo non divertenti); ai titoli contemporanei, in cui l'ambientazione è dettagliata, coerente e coesa, e le armi hanno un comportamento perfettamente plausibile (anche se raramente realistico).
Il futuro è ovviamente da scrivere. Al di là di ep. 1 e 2 che affronterò presto, in molti stanno aspettando il prossimo capitolo della saga. Probabilmente la tuta si rigenererà col passare del tempo, si potranno portare un numero limitato di armi, per sparare bisognerà mirare e sarà presente un tasto dedicato per lanciare le granate. Nonostante la "mancanza" di queste innovazioni il gioco resta senza dubbio da provare.

This is an excellent game and one of the greatest PC games I have ever played. A game that hasn't aged a bit. If this game was released today, it would still be a big hit. This game is far superior to the original Half-Life in every way. By comparison, Half-Life is Metroid and Half-Life 2 is Super Metroid.

FINAL RATING: 97 out of 100

So it's been a real long time I haven't played this game and boy it still has it's touch. Even if ages has passed this game still looks great in both storyline, graphics and finally new gameplay. Sure, we go again as the famous Dr. Feeman with his suit shooting stuff but we get new more:

- Boat chases
- New weapons
- Car driving
- Saving the world again from aliens or something like that

It all feels so well nostalgic as the original game but with new aspects, which makes us wait for more and more until the very end. Gabe, please just give us episode 3 already!

Half-Life 2 is my personal favourite game of all time. 
THIS is the franchise that has single-handily opened my eyes to the art of surrealism and hard (pulpy) sci-fi horror. 

There really wasn't (and still isn't) anything quite like Half-Life. The way the narrative is told, the share mechanics and refinement of the FPS troupes. it truly is quite the spectical.  

Everyone wanted to be Half-Life, nothing has changed in the FPS genre. To this day Half-Life 2 still stands as one for the most expertly crafted video games that I highly recommend playing. 

I had a share blast re-visiting this gem and blasting through it during the lock-down. Highly highly highly recommend it.
great

It's been 12 years since this game was released, yet despite it's age, it lives up to the test of time astoundingly well. It excels in gameplay, style, sound design, story, and even if the graphics are now on the rough side, there are still some truly spectacular looking setpieces in the game. You'll find yourself intending to have a quick session of it and end up reaching the end of Ravenholm, waving goodbye to Grigori.

The half life game of Twokfifteeeeen

Recomiendo este juego a TODO el mundo, ya no es por ser mi saga favorita de videojuegos (Gabe saca half life 3 ya). Sino por todo el ambiente "postapocaliptico" sin tener  realmente un juego de mundo-abierto, sí, es verdad que puedes explorar bastante el mapa en si, el juego es de carga de pantalla en pantalla. Al principio te dirás, Que tostón/Valla tela esperando siempre etc... Pero luego se te ara muy ameno puesto que las cargas duran entre 5seg y 15seg (que no es tanto como muchos dicen).
El apartado gráfico no es malo pese a que el juego tine muchos, muchos años de vida, es el motor source (físicas divertidas, mapas de "mini-puzles" vastante currados algunos. Cada episodio (creo que eren 11 o 12) me suele durar 45-1 hora, si soy mucho de investigar aunque me haya pasado el juego 20 veces, asique tendréis que jugar. 
El juego en su totalidad es (para mí) una obra maestra de los videojuegos TODA LA SAGA desde el 1 hasta el futuro o no tan futuro half life 3. NOTA: 10/10
